engrossed-amendment-form.current-chamber: In the Senate of the United States,

section.text: That the bill from the House of Representatives (H.R. 2497) entitled An Act to establish the Amache National Historic Site in the State of Colorado as a Unit of the National Park System, and for other purposes., do pass with the following

amendment-instruction.text: In section 3, strike subsection (f) and insert the following:

subsection.text: The Secretary may acquire land or interests in land located within the boundary of the Camp Amache National Historic Landmark, as generally depicted on the Map, only by donation.

amendment-instruction.text: On page 4, line 13, strike paragraph (1) and insert subsection (f).
On page 6, line 17, strike (1) The town of Granada, Colorado, shall maintain responsibility for the operation and maintenance and insert.

text.added-phrase: Nothing in this Act affects the authority of the town of Granada, Colorado, with respect to the operation and maintenance

amendment-instruction.text: On page 7, line 1, strike (2) The Secretary shall provide the town of and insert:

text.added-phrase: The Secretary shall provide the town of

amendment-instruction.text: On page 7, line 6, strike (3) to end of line 20 and insert:

paragraph.text: The Secretary may permit the town of Granada, Colorado, to construct or install new water infrastructure, systems, or appurtenancesâ€”

subparagraph.text: limited to the areas determined to be necessary under paragraph (2); and
in a manner that ensures the preservation, protection, and proper management of the National Historic Site.

paragraph.text: The Secretary may accept, for addition to and administration as part of the National Historic Site, the donation of water infrastructure, systems, or appurtenances within the boundary of the National Historic Site, including associated water rights, if the water infrastructure, systems, or appurtenances are no longer used by the town of Granada, Colorado.
